metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0474 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use after free in GuestView in Google Chrome prior to 109.0.5414.119allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extensionto potentially exploit heap corruption via a Chrome web app. (Chromiumsecurity severity: Medium)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0474` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
